page.title: 18SESSAY - TRANSPORT ?
page.content: Possession of a{car}is becoming an essential of village life and Sessay is no exception. Hutton Sessay is only a short walk, albeit uphill, from a regular{'bus service}to most nearby towns. From Sessay however, apart from the school 'bus, there are only three services per week, two of which run on Mondays to Thirsk - also our nearest railway station. However{mobile services}can provide the necessities of life. Butcher,baker fishmonger and general store all call at least once a week; a mobile library comes once a fortnight, and Sessay has a Post Office. In Summer such services are supplemented by a shop at the caravan site and fresh produce avail- able at the two market gardens which, ironically, draw people from the towns to shop in the country :- {but only of course if they have a car!
